# `r COR` Univariate CoR: Cox Models of Risk {#cor-coxph-Day`r COR`}

The main regression model is the Cox proportional hazards model. All plots are made with Cox models fit unless specified otherwise.

## Hazard ratios




```{r, echo=FALSE, results='asis'}

variants=list(US="Ancestral.Lineage",
              LatAme=c("Ancestral.Lineage", "Gamma", "Lambda", "Mu", "Zeta"),
              RSA="Beta")

regions=c("US","LatAm","RSA")

for (iRegion in 1:3) {
  region=regions[iRegion]
  for (variant in variants[[iRegion]]) {
    cat(paste0("
\\subsection{",region,", ",variant,"}    
    
\\setlength{\\tabcolsep}{.5ex}
  \\input{", pathCoRoutput, "/CoR_univariable_svycoxph_pretty_", region, "_", variant, "}
\\vspace{-20pt}
$\\ast$Baseline covariates adjusted for: ", covariates_adjusted, ".
", special.note, "

\\vspace{10pt}

\\setlength{\\tabcolsep}{.5ex}
  \\input{", pathCoRoutput, "/CoR_univariable_svycoxph_pretty_scaled_", region, "_", variant, "}
\\vspace{-20pt}
$\\ast$Baseline covariates adjusted for: ", covariates_adjusted, ". 
", special.note, "

\\vspace{10pt}

\\scriptsize
\\input{", paste0(pathCoRoutput, "/CoR_univariable_svycoxph_cat_pretty_", region, "_", variant), "}
\\normalsize
\\vspace{-20pt}
$\\ast$Baseline covariates adjusted for: ", covariates_adjusted, ". Cutpoints (on the log10 scale): ", concatList(paste0("\\input{", pathCoRoutput, "/cutpoints_", all.markers, "_", study_name, "}"), sep=","), "
$\\ast\\ast$$\\ast$Generalized Wald-test p-value of the null hypothesis that the hazard rate is constant across the Lower, Middle, and Upper tertile groups.
", special.note, "

\\vspace{10pt}

\\begin{table}[H]
\\caption{Number of cases (", variant, ") and non-cases in ph2 or not (",region,")}
\\begin{center}
  \\input{", pathCoRoutput, "/tab1_",region,"_",variant,"}
\\end{center}
\\end{table}


\\clearpage
"))

  }
}

```
